TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RuleSettings extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
Public NotInheritable Class RuleSettings Inherits ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Configures the ASP.NET event rules. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Event rules determine which event, using which profile, is fired to which provider.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify the properties of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings> class.
``` <healthMonitoring> <rules> <add name="All Errors Default" eventName="All Errors" provider="EventLogProvider" profile="Default" minInterval="00:01:00" /> <add name="All Audits Default" eventName="All Audits" provider="SqlWebEventProvider" profile="Default" minInterval="00:00:30" /> <add name="Failure Audits Default" eventName="Failure Audits" provider="WmiWebEventProvider" profile="Critical" minInterval="00:00:30" /> <add name="Request Processing Errors" eventName="Request Processing Errors" provider="CriticalMailEventProvider" profile="Default" /> <add name="Infrastructure Notifications" eventName="Infrastructure Errors" provider="CriticalMailEventProvider" profile="Critical" /> </rules> </healthMonitoring> ```
The following code example shows how to create and set the values of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings> type. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#73](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection/CS/healthmonitoringsection.cs#73)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#73](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection/VB/healthmonitoringsection.vb#73)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using default settings; however, the name, event name, and provider are specified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the default settings that are used for this constructor.
|Property|Default value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings.Custom%2A>|An empty string ("").| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings.MaxLimit%2A>|<xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>.| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings.MinInstances%2A>|1.| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings.MinInterval%2A>|0 ticks.| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings.Profile%2A>|An empty string ("").|

remarks.format:
## Remarks The type reference is formed as follows (items in brackets are not required): *Namespace*.*Typename*, *Assemblyname*[,] [Version=x,] [Culture=y,] [PublicKeyToken=z]. For example, "ExampleNameSpace.ExampleType, Example.Assembly, Version=%ASSEMBLY_VERSION%, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=%MICROSOFT_PUBLICKEY%"

MemberSignature.Value: public int MaxLimit { get; set; }
.property instance int32 MaxLimit
Public Property MaxLimit As Integer
public: property int MaxLimit { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxLimit : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times events of the same type are raised.
Docs.value: The maximum number of times events of the same type are raised. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
This represents the maximum number of times an event of the same type will be raised. For example, if the value is `10`, then the event will be raised 10 times and ignored thereafter.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings.MaxLimit%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#89](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection/CS/healthmonitoringsection.cs#89)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#89](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection/VB/healthmonitoringsection.vb#89)]

MemberSignature.Value: public int MinInstances { get; set; }
.property instance int32 MinInstances
Public Property MinInstances As Integer
public: property int MinInstances { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MinInstances : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of occurrences of the same type of event before the event is raised to the provider.
Docs.value: The minimum number of occurrences of the same type of event before the event is raised to the provider. The default value is 1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
This represents the minimum number of times an event occurs before an event is raised to the provider. For example, if the return value is `5`, then ASP.NET will not raise an event to the provider until the fifth instance of the event occurs.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings.MinInstances%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#90](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection/CS/healthmonitoringsection.cs#90)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#90](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection/VB/healthmonitoringsection.vb#90)]

Public Property MinInterval As TimeSpan
public: property TimeSpan MinInterval { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.MinInterval : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum time interval between two events of the same type.
Docs.value: The minimum time interval between two events of the same type. The default value is 0 ticks.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
If the value is zero, then there is no minimum interval.
